name: KTDC Lake Palace Thekkady

reviews.text: Everything about the place itself is in previous reviews - but the word 'palatial', used both by the hotel and some tour operators to describe the rooms is a major exaggeration.
reviews.title: Nice place, bathrooms desperately tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom is big and very old-fashioned: the bathroom is pretty appalling. Not just old and tired, but really scruffy with big rust marks on the messy bath, filthy black grouting, and really not nice at all. It would be poor even for a 2 star establishment at a quarter of the price.
reviews.title: Far from the madding crowd

reviews.text: The staff are lovely, the food very nice, and it is indeed atmospheric - but it's a big pity (and really rather irritating) that this Government run hotel should have had so little investment. It needs some serious renovating.
reviews.title: Peaceful retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the boat jetty we were made very welcome. The palace is absolutely beautiful with very clean, well-equiped rooms and a highly efficient staff. During our tour of the small hotel, we were introduced to the chef, Mr Mohan, who cooked us wonderful meals and invited the foodie in our company to be in everybody’s way in the kitchen with notebook and camera to write some recipes down. Twice! We enjoyed our stay, did not do a whole lot, just relished the peace, the food, the birds - and the bottle of Indian white at dinner. At the end of our three nights’ stay, the entire staff came out to say goodbye, and to give us a pressing invitation to return. Which, if we ever hit Periyar again, we will surely do as we had a wonderful time there.
reviews.title: Not the worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to get away from it all after a stint in the huzzle and buzzle of daily life in India, this is the right place.
reviews.title: Had a Fabulous Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lake Palace is a beautiful old hunting lodge set in the Periyar wildlife sanctuary. It offers the only accommodation inside the sanctuary, and you feel very priviledged to be able to stay behind when all of the noisy day trippers leave. The accommodation is clean and comfortable, but basic, and the shower is just awful - the water pressure is really poor. The food isn't great - they try to cater for Western palates, and would be better sticking to local food. The staff and service are excellent - couldn't be faulted.
reviews.title: Peaceful place to stay in beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: We were extremely fortunate to watch a large herd of wild elephants take an evening stroll, just as the sun was setting.
reviews.title: A Little Bit of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! I love this place. I can't wait to go back. The service is fantastic, very attentive to your needs. The staff have stuff done for you even before you tell them what you want. The food they prepare is very traditional, home-style cooking, but it is delicious!!! They can bring breakfast or morning tea or late afternoon sandwiches to your veranda and you can watch the wildlife right from there! It's truly amazing.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet at Lake Palace
palace in periyar
reviews.text: We didn't see any tigers or elephants. But did see sambar deer, bison, otters, tons of birds, wild boars and wild horses. Apparently, the best time to go see the animals is in late March/begin of April.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, since this was the hunting lodge for the price, his niece still goes and visits there twice a year. I asked if they shut down to hotel for tourists when she is visiting and they don't. So, you never know who you may meet.
reviews.title: Characterful and Relaxing Nature Retreat

likes.liked: — Location and seeing a wild elephant swimming in the lake from the comfort of our terrace!
likes.disliked: — Set menu food - featuring fried fish at both lunch and dinner!

reviews.title: Exclusive Retreat
reviews.text: There aren't many reviews of this hotel to look at so thought I would add a few words. It is indeed as splendid and exclusive as previously described, although in addition to supporting comments about the food we would add that the water pressure is abysmal. We too had the end room (previously requested) and stayed there 24th/25th December last year. However, we were VERY LUCKY to see the Elephants, a family/group of 9 spent over 2 hours on the lakeshore overlooked by our balcony. What a perfect Christmas Present. The hotel is like stepping back in time to the era in which service and organisation were perfect - a real treat in the middle of our touring holiday. The comment that it is expensive by Indian standards needs to be put into perspective - we paid 9000 Rupees per night (just over £100 Sterling) - in UK you wouid not be able to experience this hotel for less than £500!
Ratings out of 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Lake Palace for our honeymoon. Simply put, it is an exquisite hotel in an exquisite place. Perched atop a hill and accessible only by boat, the hotel exudes Raj-era ambience and boasts the finest views of Periyar Lake and the wildlife sanctuary. We stayed in the north end room (by far the best room---request it if at all possible), and had spectacular views right from our window---we saw wild boar, sambhar deer, brilliant blue kingfishers---all while we sipped tea from our veranda at breakfast. The hotel has only six rooms, so it's always quiet, and at night we could hear the lilting nocturnal calls of hundreds of different birds. Come morning, the ever-helpful staff booked us on guided treks through the sanctuary---we spent a whole day bamboo rafting and hiking with born-and-bred Periyar guides, and we saw tiger tracks, nilgiri langurs, giant squirrels, and a stampede of wild bison from less than 50 feet away. We returned to the hotel tired, elated, and starving---so the cook, who quickly became a friend, prepared us an amazing meal of ginger chicken, chapati, and Keralan beetroot curry. I have never eaten so well in my life. The only downside was poor water pressure in the shower; I'd also advise travelers to bring lots of insect repellent, sunscreen, and binoculars. Incidentally, we booked our hotel through the Kerala Tourism website (www.ktdc.com) and were escorted to Lake Palace from the mainland by the hotel manager at nearby Aranya Nivas.
reviews.title: A breathtaking and truly unusual hotel

likes.liked: — Gorgeous setting, unique and intimate hotel, helpful and knowledgeable staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lake Palace is a most unusual hotel to the point, we almost felt priviliged to stay there. There are only six rooms, furnished as one would imagine a Maharaja's hunting lodge should be. Yes they are dated and somewhat dark, the windows only having shutters and no glass, but that is part of the atmosphere.
reviews.title: A Step Back in Time

likes.disliked: — The room did not have a stand up shower

reviews.title: over rated and over priced
reviews.text: As for service, to visit the Lake Palace Hotel is a step back to a time when hospitality was about individuality not 'the person in room number 3511". One's requirements were almost pre-empted, often there was no need to ask.

reviews.title: BOARRRRING
reviews.text: Obviously the hotel isn't for everyone, when the masses in the boat trips leave the park, the hotel is isolated, but for us that was a major part of the charm.

An added bonus to the hotel is the pampering one gets in relation to the boat trips and treks. Not only are they included, but there is no queueing. The sightseeing boat stops at the hotel jetty and there is a private section at the front reserved for the hotel. For the treks, a private boat arrives at the hotel and takes you to the main park dock, where you bypass all the other trekkers to be first on the bamboo raft to cross the river and begin the walk.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

likes.disliked: — More dining table al freso, rather than having to eat inside and miss the view
